alert.note: Alert for Atascosa; Dimmit; Edwards; Frio; Kinney; Maverick; Medina; Real; Uvalde; Val Verde; Zavala (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued January 14 at 1:28PM CST until January 15 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Saturday across the Southern Edwards Plateau and Rio Grande Plains... .A dry cold front will move through the region during the pre- dawn hours early Saturday. Very strong northwest winds will develop behind the front, with gusts near 45 mph possible through the day coinciding with minimum RH values in the upper teens in the afternoon. Fuels are drought stressed and cured through this region. Therefore, it is likely that critical fire weather conditions will occur. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 6 PM CST SATURDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE SOUTHERN EDWARDS PLATEAU AND RIO GRANDE PLAINS... The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 9 AM to 6 PM CST Saturday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * WINDS...Northwest 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 16 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread very rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Atascosa; Dimmit; Edwards; Frio; Kinney; Maverick; Medina; Real; Uvalde; Val Verde; Zavala
